name: vscode-oberon-lsp
displayName: Oberon Language support with LSP wrapper
description: Oberon language support for Niklaus Wirth's Project Oberon. Can invoke an Oberon Language Server written in Java.
author: Michael Schierl

oberonLsp.languageServer.activate.description: Use a language server to improve Oberon experience.

oberonLsp.languageServer.cache.activate.description: Use a cache directory and also scan files that are not opened (may be slow on a new project).

oberonLsp.languageServer.cache.directory.description: Controls the location of the cache directory relative to the workspace.

oberonLsp.languageServer.javaLocation.description: Controls the location of Java executable.

oberonLsp.languageServer.launchType.description: Controls the launch type for the language server.

oberonLsp.languageServer.launchTypeA2.sw.description: Command line switches for the A2 compiler, e.g. to select architecture.

oberonLsp.languageServer.launchTypeA2.sy.description: List of directories where symbol files are found (for sources not included in the workspace).

oberonLsp.languageServer.location.description: Controls the location of the installed language server.

oberonLsp.languageServer.modifiedDiskIma.description: Specify the file name of a modified disk image. Useful if you injected some symbol files into a copy of the disk image.

oberonLsp.languageServer.other1Arguments.description: Specify the command line arguments for launch type Other 1 (by default same as po2013).

oberonLsp.languageServer.other2Arguments.description: Specify the command line arguments for launch type Other 2 (by default, connecting to an external Oberon emulator via TCP).

oberonLsp.languageServer.other3Arguments.description: Specify the command line arguments for launch type Other 3 (by default, running language server under remote Java debugger).
